data.title: up a steep and very narrow stairway
data.text: my understanding is that it is the rooftop patio that makes this place special, but it's november in chicago, so we ate inside.  this restaurant is from the people who brought you lulu's and taco diablo, for the people to whom that means something, and it has a few of lulu's old dishes on the menu.  i gravitated towards those.  my friend ordered the soup of the day which was hot and sour chicken, and the sesame peanut noodles, which are one of the lulu's dishes.  i ordered the noodles, too, and the ginger chicken salad.  ah, bliss.  tons of ginger dressing, chunks of chicken, wontons for crunch, and various greens and veggies (there were definitely green beans in there).  the noodles are still creamy and tasty--i wanted them to have just a little more sauce to go with that amount of noodles, but that's nit-picking.  service is very nice and helpful.  the room is super noisy, what with the television playing various sports events.  i'm tempted to see if they have food to go so that i can get my salad and noodle fix but eat them somewhere a bit quieter.

data.title: Worth the trip
data.text: Nice rooftop atmosphere.  The Carnitas Torta was great.  The menu his limited, but worth the trip.  The view of the skyline is really nice.

data.title: Great outdoor hang
data.text: Located in a great new space, Five & Dime is a great outdoor hangout space.  Aside from the big outdoor bar and game room, you get to choose food from a hybrid of Lulu's and Taco Diablos menu.  Yeah!!

data.title: Super good!
data.text: Beef brisket sandwich is amazing.  Nachos are amazing.  Ginger beer is amazing.  And the rooftop is the clincher.  No other place like it in Evanston (that I know of).

data.title: Fun and games with great outdoor space
data.text:
We ate outside on a warm summer evening. The menu is limited to appetizers, flatbreads, sandwiches and a few salads. The cocktail menu is more extensive. We enjoyed playing ping pong and darts in this space. 
Expect a wait since this is a new restaurant.

data.title: Good food GREAT rooftop!
data.text: The food was good, they offer a combination of things on the menu from taco diablos and Lulus which are both located downstairs. The food and service were on par with the former taco diablos and Lulus if you remember them. The roof is such a great space with many options to dine, play games or just hang out for drinks.

data.title: Great location, good food, service needs work.
data.text: This is a restaurant run by the owners of longtime Evanston favorite LuLu's and the newer Taco Diablo.  The food is some of the same that was at both of those restaurants.  It's a nice location on Davis and the rooftop is great in the summer evenings.  We really enjoyed having some of the old favorites like the Ginger Chicken Salad and the Peanut Noodles.  The gazpacho was ok, not great.  The service was slow and inattentive.  Hopefully it's just that they are training new staff.  We will definitely return.

data.title: Very Cool; Easy-Going Spot
data.text: Will be trying it again; one quick trip for a snack in the evening.   The frozen drinks looked delicious, that's what I'll try next time.   Had Quesadilla'; good but not special in itself, but was served with some great cole slaw and a tiny bit of delicious green salad.   The roof-top seating is great on a warm summer evening.   Somewhat limited menu; not sure if that will be permanent.

data.title: Two Disappointing Experiences
data.text:
I have been to Five & Dime twice within the last few weeks, both for work functions.  On the first visit, each event attendee was issued three drink tickets.  I gave my first drink ticket to a waitress, and waited 10 minutes, but no drink.  I gave my second drink ticket to a different waitress, waited 10 minutes--still no drink.  I finally walked directly up to the bar, gave the bartender my final drink ticket, and asked if they could bring me the drink at the nearby pinball machine, where I was playing.  After an additional 10 minutes, with no drink in sight, I left the Five & Dime in total frustration.  I understand that this was their second private event upon opening, but there really is no excuse for this abysmal level of service.

My second visit was last week, for a fellow staff member's going away party.  I was hesitant to attend given my previous experience, but decided to give it a go.  I first tried to order a draft beer from our waiter, but was informed that there were no beer on tap even though a selection was listed on the menu.  I then ordered my favorite bottled beer from a microbrewery in Michigan, only to be told that they had run out of it as well.  Finally, after five attempts over two visits, I received my first drink at Five & Dime.   The beer was recommended by the waiter and was a good choice.  However, the $6 price tag for a local bottled beer seemed a bit steep.  When I received the check, there was an automatic 20% gratuity on the bill--on a drinks-only tab for two people!

I have to say, the venue itself is quite nice--an expansive rooftop, numerous tables and umbrellas, and three quality pinball machines.  However, I don't know if I can bring myself to come back to Five & Dime again, given my initial experiences.  I am hopeful that they can work out all of the kinks before they get a negative reputation, as this could be a great place to go for an open air beverage and meal.  Given the competition for restaurants and bars in Evanston, there are alot of other good options with significantly better service and customer experiences.

data.title: Dinner with inlaws
data.text: Dinner with in laws.  Nice place just opened in Evanston.  Looking forward to reopening of Lulu's and Taco Diablo.  Food was good and service great.  Better then the last time we went.  Limited menu forced me to give it a 4 of 5.

data.title: We loved the place
data.text:
Finally a place in Evanston where you can eat outside without stand on a sidewalk... The place is brand new, in a rooftop with areas outside and inside: nice place, with friendly waiters and good folks all around.
About the food, we ate a classic burger and shrimp salad: both dishes were very good.
The service was fast but kind... everything perfect, a pleasant surprise.
And at the end the price was adequate for the food we ate.
I cannot say nothing about the drink because we just drunk water.
For family with kids: a play area available!

data.title: Buenisimo!
data.text: Lindo sitio para tomar unos tragos. Recomiendo pedir una mesa en el rooftop si es verano, el ambiente es lindo y acogedor. Buenas opciones de piqueos y variedad de cervezas.
